template_details.name: Clinical-Coded Phenotype
template_details.description: Phenotype definitions that are based on lists of clinical codes, or algorithms using clinical codes.

sections.title: Overview
sections.description: An overview of the phenotype with basic metadata.

sections.title: Implementation
sections.description: How this phenotype definition is run against data.

sections.title: Validation
sections.description: Description of how correctness, appropriateness, and/or quality was assessed.

sections.title: Clinical Code List
sections.description: Clinical codes used to define this phenotype.

sections.title: Publication
sections.description: Publication(s) where this phenotype is defined and/or used.

type.title: Phenotype Type
type.description: The category of patient characteristic this phenotype falls under.

data_sources.title: Data Sources
data_sources.description: Data sources the phenotype creators have run this phenotype against; or view as appropriate to use this phenotype for.

event_date_range.title: Valid Event Date Range
event_date_range.description: If this phenotype is only applicable within a limited time period, please specify that here (optional).

sex.title: Sex
sex.description: The biological sex this phenotype is applicable to.

agreement_date.title: Agreement Date
agreement_date.description: A date representing when this phenotype was first finalized (may predate the Phenotype Library). Deprecated.

coding_system.title: Coding System
coding_system.description: Clinical coding system(s) contained within this phenotype. A phenotype may have multiple concepts, each with its own coding system. All contained coding systems are programmatically represented here.

phenoflowid.title: Phenoflow ID
phenoflowid.description: ID of this phenotype's PhenoFLOW implementation, if applicable. For more information: https://kclhi.org/phenoflow/

concept_information.title: Clinical Codes
concept_information.description: A set of concepts, each of which defines a list of clinical codes, contained within this phenotype.

source_reference.title: Source Reference
source_reference.description: If this phenotype is derived from a third-party source, define that here. Deprecated.
